HELP:
1 – HOW TO MAKE AN APPOINTMENT

Download our app from the AppStore or Google Play, and book your hair services in as little as 60 minutes before your desired appointment time and up 2 months in advance.

Simply select the address where you want to have your service performed (home, office or hotel address) then pick the date and desired hour, and finally select the services you need. The App will inform you if we have not available any professional (wuappers) at the time you would like the service, so you have the chance to pick another available time.

In order to complete the order you will be asked to select a valid credit card to pay the services. Please be aware that you won’t be charged any fee until the service is completed.

2 – WHERE IS WUAPPA SERVICE AVAILABLE

Currently WUAPPA is available in Geneva, Switzerland

3 – CAN I CANCEL MY APPOINTMENT

Yes, you can cancel the service at any time, but beware that cancellation fees maybe applicable depending on your notice period for the cancelation.

If you cancel the service within the 3 hours before the appointment time, you will be charged a penalty equivalent to 50% of the service price. If you cancel the service with only one-hour notice before the appointment time, you will be charged a penalty equivalent to the service full price.

CONTACT US: Email: support@wuappa.com
TERMS:
TERMS AND CONDITIONS

1. Scope

These Terms and Conditions ("T&C") are intended to present the rules of use of the mobile application "Wuappa" (hereinafter "The Application").

The "Wuappa" Application is published and operated by the Company "B-Rush Sàrl" (hereinafter "The Operator"), a company whose registered office is at Route de la Capite 20, 1223 Cologny, Canton of Geneva , Switzerland, company registered in the commercial register of this canton.

All persons installing and / or using the Application (hereinafter "the Users") acknowledge to be bound by these General Conditions, which they declare to have read and understood and undertake to respect them without reserve. These Terms and Conditions may be consulted at any time on the Application.

The Operator reserves the right, in its sole discretion, to modify these Terms and Conditions at any time. Users are responsible for consulting them regularly in order to keep themselves informed of any changes. Any changes made by the Operator are brought to the attention of Users by their mere posting. They are deemed accepted without reservation by any User who accesses the application after the posting.

2. Purpose of the Application

The Application serves as an intermediary between hairdressers and people wishing to be styled at home (these two groups hereinafter referred to together as "Users").

Through the platform provided by the Application, Users are able to easily find a hairdresser who suits them and who moves directly to their home in due time or customers wanting to be styled.

3. Provision of the application

In order to use the Application, Users must be in possession of the following:

o An Apple iPhone or iPad with the IOS 11 operating system or higher or Android OS;

o Internet Access.

4. Financial conditions

4.1 Download

The App is downloadable for free from the "Apple Store" and "Google Play" platforms.

Users assume the costs related to their telephone subscriptions and those related to their internet access.

4.2 Price

Unless otherwise agreed, all prices are quoted in Swiss francs (CHF). The Operator reserves the right to quote prices in other currencies according to the countries in which its services will be provided.

All prices quoted include additional amounts relating to Value Added Tax (VAT), where applicable. The applicable VAT rate is determined according to the country concerned.

Prices do not include any additional taxes that would apply.

The Operator reserves the right to modify its prices at any time. Prices shown apply at the time of conclusion of the contract.

If it is expected that a commission will be paid, it will be payable as soon as the Operator has executed its obligations, that is to say have served as an intermediary. The fact that Users pay the agreed price for the haircut concerned does not play any role vis-à-vis the Operator. It is the performance of the obligation of intermediation by the Operator that is relevant.

4.3 Payment

The Operator offers Users the following payment terms: Credit Card.

Users wishing to use the services of the hairdressers will have to pay 100% of the payment relating to the service that will perform them through the payment agency provided by the Operator. 80% (eighty percent) of this amount will go to the concerned hairdresser (less the affiliation fees to the paying agency) and 20% (twenty percent) will go to the Operator. The paying agency will make payments every 7 (seven) days.

Generally, the price of the service must be paid in full by the Users upon conclusion of the contract.

In certain cases, the Operator may, at its sole discretion, issue an invoice to Users following the service ordered. In this case, if the invoice is not paid within the aforementioned period, Users will immediately be notified. As soon as the notice of default is given, the Users undertake to pay default interest of 5% (five per cent).

The Operator reserves the right to demand the payment of an advance at any time and without giving reasons.

It is not possible for the Users to compensate any claim on the amount of the invoice that they must pay to the Operator.

The Operator reserves the right to waive service in case of late payment.

5. Cancellation of the order

When a contractual deadline is provided, the cancellation of an order does not generate any additional cost if the Users cancel their order at least 4 (four) hours before this deadline.

In case of default or in case of late cancellation, the following additional costs will be due:

"If the cancellation is made 3 (three) hours before the agreed time, 50% (fifty percent) of the agreed price is due;

"If the cancellation is made 1 (one) hour before the agreed time, 100% (one hundred percent) of the agreed price is due.

6. Minimum age

By accepting these Terms and Conditions, Users confirm that they meet the age limit required by the Operator in relation to the services it offers. In general, the Operator does not provide services to persons under 18 years of age. The Operator reserves the right in its sole discretion to contract with minors depending on the circumstances.

7. Warranty, Risks and Liability

The Application is normally accessible 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, except in the case of maintenance, technical faults or major forces. Maintenance interventions may be performed without the Users having been previously notified. The Operator will endeavor to make the Application usable and to correct any potential bug. However, the operator of the Application cannot be held responsible for the impossibility to access the Application or any damage for any reason whatsoever. The Application is made available without any guarantee whatsoever. The liability of the Operator is expressly excluded in the event of any damage (direct or indirect) (except contrary mandatory legal provisions).

The Application acts as an intermediary to connect hairdressers and potential customers who wish to engage the services of these ("Users"). The Operator strives to select the best hairdressers who will use the application to meet the requirements of customers. These hairdressers practice as freelancers and are neither employees nor auxiliaries of the Operator. For this reason, the Operator assumes no responsibility for the relationship between hairdressers and customers. Potential claims or claims related to services offered (haircut, price, payment, absence etc) can not be addressed to the Operator and must be paid between Users.

The information provided by the Application is provided for informational purposes only, is not contractual and can not engage the responsibility of the Operator. They can be modified or updated without notice. The Operator can in no way be held responsible for any errors and / or errors that the Application may contain.

By using the Application, Users assume all the negative consequences that may be caused by the Application. They must take all appropriate measures to protect their own data and / or software stored on their equipment (telephone, computer, etc.) against any infringement (malfunction, virus, hacking, non-exhaustive list).

8. Obligations of Users

In order to use the Application, Users must create a user profile.

To do this, the following data must be provided by hairdressers:

  • Name;
  • First name
  • Home Address
  • Phone number
  • E-mail address
  • Bank reference (RIB)
  • Copy of hairdresser diploma
  • Excerpt from the clean criminal record

The following data must be provided by the hairdressers' customers:

  • Name
  • First name
  • Home Address
  • Phone number
  • E-mail address
  • Method of payment.

In addition, Users expressly undertake:

o Take as soon as possible all necessary measures so that the Operator and the other Users can provide their services. Users must take all these measures instead, at the time and in the manner agreed upon. Depending on the circumstances, Users will also be required to provide all necessary information and documents to the Operator;

o Not to reproduce, temporarily and / or permanently, all or part of the Application whether the content and / or functionalities regardless of the purpose or mode of dissemination;

o Not to use programs or other systems that may cause disruption to the Application that renders it unusable;

o Not to sell, rent, sublicense or otherwise distribute the Application and / or content to third parties;

Users expressly accept:

o To receive practical information, advertising messages or promotional offers related to the activities of the partners related to the Application or the Operator.

9. Data protection

The Operator processes and uses the personal data of the Users collected through the Application in order to better fulfill its mission and to improve the use of the Application.

The Operator shall take all necessary measures to ensure the protection of the data in accordance with the legal provisions. Users agree that their data is recorded and used and are aware that the Operator may disclose their data or that of third parties in case of injunctions from a court or authority. Unless the Users expressly exclude it, the Operator is entitled to use their data for marketing purposes. The data necessary to perform the service may be transferred to the service partners authorized by the Operator and to other third parties.

Data protection legislation applies.

10. Confidentiality

The Users, the Operator or their assistants undertake to keep secret any information that has been exchanged or acquired as part of the Use of the Application. The obligation of confidentiality persists even after the end of the use of the Application or in case of deletion thereof.

11. Intellectual property

The Operator of the Application has all the intellectual property rights relating thereto.

These Terms and Conditions do not deal with the assignment of intellectual property rights, unless this is expressly provided for.

Users must ensure that they do not infringe any intellectual property rights when using content, images, text or figurative elements, when they use them in connection with the Application. All rights of reproduction and representation are reserved, including downloadable documents. All texts, graphics, icons, photographs, plans, logos, videos, sounds, brands, and more generally all elements comprising the Application may not be the subject of any representation, reproduction, exploitation or extraction, in whole or in part, on any medium whatsoever, without the express prior authorization of the Operator.

12. Hypertext links

The Application may contain hypertext links to other websites (eg Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.). Users visit these sites under their sole and exclusive responsibility. The Operator can in no way be held responsible for any damage resulting from the consultation of these sites or their content.

13. Push Notifications

The Application can send "push notifications". The use of these notifications requires the prior consent of Users. To do this, Users must accept, if they wish, the sending of push notifications by configuring the settings of their mobile device. This feature can, at any time and for free, be enabled or disabled.

If they accept that push notifications are sent to them, the Users will then be able to receive messages (in the form of text) of an informative, practical and / or advertising nature even when the Application is closed.

14. Completeness

These Terms and Conditions supersede any prior agreements or arrangements. Only the provisions of individual contracts that specify these General Conditions take precedence over them.

15. Severability clause

The validity of these Terms and Conditions will not be affected if any of its provisions or any of its annexes is or was to be declared invalid. In this case, the invalid or invalid provision will be replaced by a valid provision that is close to the purpose of the invalid or invalid provision. The same applies in the event of a possible contractual gap.

16. Applicable Law and Judiciary

These Terms and Conditions are subject to Swiss law.

The courts of the Canton of Geneva are competent to settle any dispute between the Users and the Operator, except contrary mandatory legal provisions.

The Operator is free to bring legal action to the defendant's domicile / domicile.

17. Contact

For any question or request for information, Users may send an e-mail to the following address: info@wuappa.com or send an e-mail to the following address: "Société B-Rush Sàrl", Route de la Capite 20, 1223 Cologny, Canton of Geneva, Switzerland ".
